subject: Climate & Environment
title: Geothermal Energy
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Geothermal Energy.

hook.text: Drill deep enough anywhere on Earth and you will hit rock hot enough to boil water.

buildup.text: Iceland uses geothermal heat to warm 90% of its homes and generate a third of its power.

discovery.text: Steam from underground reservoirs spins turbines just like coal or gas â€” minus the emissions.

twist.text: New drilling technology could unlock geothermal almost anywhere, not just volcanic zones.

climax.text: Enhanced geothermal systems inject water into hot rock and harvest the resulting steam.

punchline.text: The biggest power plant is the one under our feet.

quiz.question: What percentage of Iceland's homes are heated with geothermal energy?
